Key Findings

  • Fylde Borough Council has spent a total of £157.4M across 11 financial years from 2015/16 to 2025/26.
  • The STRATEGIC DEVELOPMENT department accounts for 30.1% of the total spend, amounting to £47.4M.
  • The top three departments by spend are STRATEGIC DEVELOPMENT (£47.4M), COMMUNITY SERVICES (£34.4M), and GOVERNANCE AND PARTNERSHIPS (£33.2M), totaling £115M or 73.1% of the total spend.

Departmental Spending Breakdown

The spending data for Fylde Borough Council reveals a clear hierarchy in terms of departmental allocations. The STRATEGIC DEVELOPMENT department leads with £47.4M, which is 30.1% of the total spend. This significant investment suggests a strong focus on strategic development initiatives within the council.

Following closely are the COMMUNITY SERVICES and GOVERNANCE AND PARTNERSHIPS departments, with spends of £34.4M and £33.2M, respectively. These figures indicate a substantial commitment to community welfare and governance, reflecting the council's priorities in these areas.

A detailed breakdown of the top departments by spend is provided in the table below:
Department Amount % of Total
STRATEGIC DEVELOPMENT £47.4M 30.1%
COMMUNITY SERVICES £34.4M 21.9%
GOVERNANCE AND PARTNERSHIPS £33.2M 21.1%

Operational and Strategic Planning

Beyond the top three departments, OPERATIONAL SERVICES and STRATEGIC PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT also receive significant allocations, with £26.2M and £14.6M, respectively. These figures highlight the importance of operational efficiency and strategic planning in the council's overall programme.

The CHIEF EXECUTIVE department has a spend of £1.4M, which is 0.9% of the total. This relatively smaller allocation is dedicated to the executive functions of the council, including leadership and management.

What You Can Do

  • Submit a Freedom of Information request to Fylde Borough Council about the specific initiatives and projects funded under the STRATEGIC DEVELOPMENT department.
  • Attend council committee meetings, which are open to the public, to gain insight into the decision-making process behind departmental spending allocations.
  • Check the council's published contracts register to find out more about the suppliers and partners working with the council across different departments.
  • Write to your local councillor about your concerns or suggestions regarding the allocation of funds to different departments and services.
  • Visit aidoge.co.uk to explore the full spending data and analyse the trends in departmental spending over the 11-year period.
This article is based on Fylde Borough Council's published spending data covering 2015/16 to 2025/26. All figures are drawn directly from transactions published under the Local Government Transparency Code. Analysis by AI DOGE.
